page.title: 09Three Horseshoes, Batcombe.
page.content:
The Three Horse Shoes is now the only{public house}in{Batcombe.
Being on the{Roman road}from{Bath to{Glastonbury}it was originally a {15th century coach house}and was obliged to accept any person requiring accomodation. Only the{church}is older.
{Games}consist of;{shove penny, table {skittles, alley skittles}and also a {fruit machine.
The store house use to be a stable. Some windows were blocked up during 17th century to avoid{window tax.}Two were re-opened in 1980. A passage runs from the lounge to the church yard.
Custom is now mainly local although there are occasional{tourists.
